SCANDALOUS.Definition: causing public feelings of shock and anger

HEADLINES.Definition: the titles of a newspaper story

SCANDALS.Definition: events that cause public feelings of shock and anger

XENOPHOBIA.Definition: fear of and hate against people from other countries

BACKGROUND.Definition: knowledge about the circumstances or conditions

SUBTLETY.Definition: very small details or differences which are not obvious

SHY AWAY.Definition: avoid it because they are afraid of something

TONE IT DOWN.Definition: make it less extreme or intense

SUNK.Definition: sent at the bottom of the sea

MINCE ITS WORDS.Definition: wasn't careful or polite about what it published

HEADLINE.Definition: the title of a newspaper story

RHETORIC.Definition: language designed to have a persuasive or impressive effect

MONEY SPINNERS.Definition: ideas that provided a lot of money

EXCEPTION.Definition: something that is excluded from the statement

HARMLESS.Definition: not able or likely to cause damage or harm

SENSATIONALISE.Definition: present them in an exciting and attractive way

ABUNDANTLY.Definition: to a great extent or degree

STICK.Definition: don't change their opinions or support

HYPOCRISY.Definition: acting like it was better than it really was
